intro: Enicosanthellum plagioneurum var. oblanceolatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed bellflower, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet or blue flowers. The leaves are typically broad and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
